result.execSummary:
Kristianna L Roth was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Kristianna L Roth was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristianna L Roth

defendant.name: Roth, Kristianna L
defendant.address: West Union Residential Facility 500 South Pine Str, West Union, IA 52175

records.addlTxt:
9:15 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kristianna L Roth in court, in custody in the Crawford County Jail.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Steiner is heard, no arrest warrant in the State of Iowa. Iowa department of Corrections is requesting a return due to an escape. 
Defendant is heard on what it would take to get an attorney. Defendant comments on trying to get probation revoked in Iowa. 

Court provides a copy of the criminal complaint of extradition, Fayette County, State of Iowa. 
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 

Court reviews waiver of extradition form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 
Defendant agrees to waiver of extradition. Defendant initials complaint. 

Defendant signs waiver of extradition. 
Court finds defendants waiver of extradition has been made freely, knowingly and voluntarily. 

Court certifies and signs waiver. Court provides a copy to the defendant. Sheriffs department will contact Fayette county to make arrangements for transfer.
